revised_title: Observations of the Occultation of Mars by the Moon on October 7, 1736
tldr: This article reports two separate observations of the occultation of Mars by the Moon on October 7, 1736, made by George Graham and John Bevis. The observations were conducted in London and Covent Garden, respectively, using telescopes. The authors provide detailed timings and descriptions of the event, noting the challenges posed by cloud cover.
